source.author: Duretto, M.F.
source.title: Rutaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Duretto, M.F. (1999). Rutaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Most leaves greater than 14 mm long
Most leaves less than 13 mm long
Lower surface of leaves and petals silver- lepidote; leaves elliptic to obovate, apex rounded
Lower surface of leaves and petals ferruginous or silver-ferruginous; leaves narrow-oblong to elliptic, apex obtuse to truncate or retuse
Leaves oblong to elliptic, margins not or slightly recurved
Leaves oblong-ovate to broad-obovate, margins strongly recurved
